title: You have the chance to give one buff to your main
body:
Darius's Passive can now apply spell effects.

(NOTE: With this buff, Darius can actually use Deathfire Touch, and it will proc on his passive. So imagine an AD Brand kinda thing. Paired with his Noxian Might's AD steroid, that will be pretty bonkers. It will also put his old passive to shame).

GO

{{champion:236}} I haven't played him much recently, but I still have 170k points on him, unless I'm mistaken. 
Now has 650 range
Q: Now has 650 range
W: Now does Physical Damage and scales off AD
E: Passive hits INSTANTLY reset passive (interesting thing, if you're fast enough, you can dash three times in one passive, once before the first shot hits, once before the second shot hits, and once after)

One buff
The E gets buffed then, because I like that idea
Hang on, if E instantly resets from passive, and E procs passive, you would literally dash as long as you have mana, and once you get E to lvl 5 where it's free, you literally become kalista.
Worse than kalista. She doesn't get an additional shot of 50% damage, plus hers is linked to both attack speed and movement speed; lucian's dash is not.
Core concept of kalista here, though yes, 10x the damage. I'm also pretty sure lucian's passive means all his abilities are AA resets.

Although on a serious note I would love that {{champion:161}} would gain that true damage on a researched target for all his abilities, kind of like {{champion:86}} villian.  It just feels like most of the time the research passive on your ult is pretty much cast a spell, W, ult.

I've always thought that a decent change to Vel'Koz would be letting all of his basic spells deal 10% true damage on Researched targets, but he can't proc Organic Deconstruction on enemies who are Researched. Does the Vel'Koz go for sudden burst or sustained damage? It should make an interesting dynamic, no?
put Elise's healing back on her W, and make her spiderlings heal her again.
I guess that buff seems reasonable seeing as how she isn't getting a massive damage buff.

She definitely doesn't need damage. As a mid Elise, the change from heal to her passive hit her harder than almost any other change. Her ability to survive against bad matchups fringed on healing in opportune times, and the current system only lets you heal if you are ahead of your laning opponent, which isn't healthy in my opinion.
No i mean from some of these comments, they try to overload the damage for the buff. Adding in a heal as a buff seems nice.
